column15: Outside room and to west at 45 degree angle is large block of Sarno Baths.  Approached from ground level by corridor number 1 leading to number 2. column21: Room of irregular shape!  (Rectangular-Have architects check) with a beveled southeast corner- presumably following contour of cliff.  No indication of original floor covering.  Room still covered with earth and undergrowth which has been recently chopped away.  In addition to door near middle of east wall that connected to area number 2 is another door in northwest corner.  Large window in north wall looks back into building (?).  How much of window has been rebuilt?  Remains of wall painting in north wall and north end of east wall.  There must have been large windows to south and west, but wall isn't high enough to indicate their presence.
column53: Two possible rooms with hand drawn floor plan

column21: Nicely preserved rectangular vaulted room looking south with view interrupted by wall between it and corridor 4 and by dining room 3.  Question is-was this room for dining room that should be associated with earlier phase of structure that could have been replaced or augmented by construction of room 3 (See fact sheet for this room).  See PPM vol. 8 for better photos of background paintings.  Most of wall surface on north, east, west walls in place, but no figures are seen.  Nice molded egg and dart molding preserved at spring line on east and west flank walls.  Same continued on north wall as base of segmental arch.  Taller molding of swags define the crown of the segmental arch.  Same molding placed above egg and dart as well.  (Look for reference on molding.)

Partition wall in center of room separates kitchen area from storage to the west.  Base of vaulted ceiling still extant.  Debris fills much of the room.

The size and position of the room suggest its use as a dining room.

column14: Enters from room 7; overlooks room 12.
column21: Small room with a barrel vaulted ceiling.  There is a window facing the terrace.  Probably used as a winter dining room; the small doorway would have helped to enclose heat.  Fourth Style painting on the northeast wall.

column14: Room 31 to the south, no partition wall survives.

column21: To the right/northwest as one enters is a cooking platform with an arched niche below. On wall to left as one faces the platform, approximately 3-4 feet above level of platform is a niche lararium.  Room 30 is divided by room 31 in rear although walls are no longer standing.  Room 31 identified by Eschebach as a stable although more likely a latrine or storeroom.  No evidence to distinguish its use.  From the northwest and southeast corners of room 30, Eschebach has indications of a structure no longer extant.  No indication of its use.

column14: Lararium (feature 1446) on west wall above.

column21: Small square room.  Recess in southeast corner.  Small window in southeast corner of rear wall opening into kitchen (room 30).  Niche position, window support use as storage.  Plaster survives in southwest corner, undecorated.

column14: Cooking platform (feature 1444) below at northwest.
column21: Plaster-line lararium niche in the west wall above cooking platform.  Traces of plaster molding survive.  Painted vegetation on the rear of the niche.

column14: Peristyle (room 21) to the north.
column21: Dining room facing peristyle (room 11) to the north.  South wall with preserved wall painting.  Style uncertain.  Depiction of a rooster in upper register.  Plaster preserves the dimension of the arched ceiling.  Mosaic floor of white tesserae and colored stones survives in the south and southeast corners.  Eschebach's plan does not distinguish this as a separate room (contra PPM) and neither identify a west wall to the room.  However, plaster lip on south wall and rubble on the floor suggest the existence of a west wall which is unidentified in other sources.  Position and decoration support its use as a dining room.

column14: Rooms 21 and 23, 18 and 19
column21: Garden restaurant.  Large banquet hall on western side of house.  Entered by way of room 16 by hallway leading from room 1.  At the far western end is a room with elaborate painting showing a centaur and a standing individual (possibly Hercules).  Another room in southwest corner (room 23).  On the south side is room 21.  When excavated, the room contained a large number of amphorae.  This room was probably used as a large dining hall.  To the east of room 21 is room 20, identified by Eschebach as a kitchen.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 572-573
column14: Room 17.
column21: Garden restaurant.  With elaborate wall painting on exterior (possibly a Centaur and Hercules).  Has small door on the left.  Usage is speculative.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 572-573
column14: Rooms 1 and 17.
column21: Garden restaurant.  One enters room 15, a large garden, from room 1.  Although no physical evidence, the garden may have served as a dining areas, perhaps in the large niche on eastern wall or just inside the columns on the northeast of the room.  On south wall is a second exit.   Today no indication that walls were painted.  No drawing required.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 695

column21: Located on the northeastern side of the house, this dining room is a large rectangular room with a small opening to the atrium (room 2). House contiguous to but not connected to the large market garden at VII.6.6. Poorly preserved decoration on the southern wall.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Peristyle (room 11) and garden (room 20) located to the west.
column15: Peristyle (room 11) and garden (room 20) located to the west.
column21: The tile floor sloping south to the latrine and drain are in the southeast corner. Long rectangular room with a doorway to the peristyle (room 11) in the east wall. To the south of the doorway is an arched window providing access to a basin lined with opus signinum in peristyle. Basin (feature 1557) in the center of the east wall. There are traces of red decorations with white upper register surviving along the west wall. Shelving supports survive on the north wall for a single tier of shelves. A possible drainage channel survives against the east wall north of vat (feature 1558) with opening to the east at the floor level. Three vats (features 1558, 1555, and 1553) found along the east wall with preparation platform (feature 1556) to the west of vat (feature 1558). Red lower register and white upper register survives on the east wall above vat (feature 1554) to arched plaster lined lararium niche. There is a stepped cooking platform (feature 1552) south of vat (feature 1553) against the east wall. There is a arched storage recess with a tiled surface and lip.  Latrine (feature 1551) in the southeast corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Cooking platform (feature 1552) located to the north. A window is located high in the west wall. Shelving support located above the east wall. Terra cotta drain running under the cooking platform from the vat (feature 1554).
column16: Cooking platform (feature 1552) located to the north. A window is located high in the west wall. Shelving support located above the east wall. Terra cotta drain running under the cooking platform from the vat (feature 1554).
column21: Rectangular space to the south of platform (feature 1552). Tiled floor draining and sloping to the east with terra cotta drain below draining onto the tile floor. The floor drops off to drain below. Holes located in the north and south walls for foot support and the seat of the latrine. The seat is no longer present leaving the drain open. A small window located high in the west wall of the latrine. Supports for shelving are located high above the latrine in the east wall.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: None
column15: Latrine (feature 1551) to the south, Vat (feature 1553) to the north. Shelving above on the east wall. Small window high in the wall to the southwest. There is an arched window to the west allowing access to the basin in peristyle 11.
column21: A rectangular cooking platform with brick arched storage recessed below. There is a tile surface and lip on the north and south edge. There is a step in front up to the level base of the cooking platform from the floor allowing easier access to the cooking surface. There is a drain running below the platform from vat (feature 1554) to latrine (feature 1551). There is evidence of supports for shelving in the east wall above the cooking platform.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: The lararium is above vat (feature 1554).
column21: Arched plaster lined lararium niche above vat (feature 1554) in east wall. Plaster below has red in the lower register; and white in the upper register. No painting survives in the lararium.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Cooking platform (feature 1552) to the south, with drain running underneath to the latrine (feature 1551); lararium (feature 1553) in the east wall above. Vat (feature 1555) to the north; arched window to water basin and doorway to peristyle to the west.
column16: Cooking platform (feature 1552) to the south, with drain running underneath to the latrine (feature 1551); lararium (feature 1553) in the east wall above. Vat (feature 1555) to the north; arched window to water basin and doorway to peristyle to the west.
column21: Rectangular vat lined with opus signinum with drains in the southwest corner that runs under cooking platform (feature 1552) to latrine (feature 1551). Base of vat slopes south to the drain in southwest corner. Channel runs along southern face at base of the vat draining through the west wall of the vat onto the terra cotta floor of room 13. Above the channel running from the interior of the vat through the west wall is a lead pipe partially preserved in situ. Plaster on wall above to the east is red in the lower register, and white in the upper register.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Vat (feature 1554) to the south, vat (feature 1558) to the north.
column16: Vat (feature 1554) to the south, vat (feature 1558) to the north.
column21: Semicircular vat; inner surface doesn't survive. West face is open to kitchen (feature 1550). Lack of lining reveals brick and stone structure. Lead pipe in northern end in vat (feature 1554) opens through the southern corner of this vat and traces of plaster survives at this point.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Vat (feature 1558) adjoining to the east; vat (feature 1555) adjoining to the south; basin (feature 1557) opposite to the west.
column16: Vat (feature 1558) adjoining to the east; vat (feature 1555) adjoining to the south; basin (feature 1557) opposite to the west.
column21: Large, rectangular preparation platform, marble single shallow indentation in the southwest corner. No traces of working on the marble.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Preparation platform (feature 1556) to the east with vat (feature 1558) against east wall. The basin is in the center of the west wall of room 13.
column16: Preparation platform (feature 1556) to the east with vat (feature 1558) against east wall. The basin is in the center of the west wall of room 13.
column21: Rectangular basin lined with opus signinum. The upper course did not survive along the east and southeast. Opus signinum survives on the base of the exterior face as part of the terra cotta floor of room 15.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Preparation platform (feature 1556) located to the west; vat (feature 1555) located to the south; drain runs west to room 1550. Possible drain channel runs north of the vat with an opening through the east wall at ground level.
column16: Preparation platform (feature 1556) located to the west; vat (feature 1555) located to the south; drain runs west to room 1550. Possible drain channel runs north of the vat with an opening through the east wall at ground level.
column21: Rectangular vat lined with opus signinum. Northern face of the vat does not survive. In the middle of the vat approximately one foot from the north is a terra cotta lined drain descending vertically; the base is obscured by debris. A drain in the west wall opposite a terra cotta drain drains from the base of the vat onto the tile floor from the room (feature 1550).

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Peristyle to west.
column21: Small dining room to west of andron. Room was nicely decorated in third style. Room was not completely rectangular. In the northwest corner there was a slight projection of the wall. In the southwest corner there is a doorway leading into the andron. A larger opening in the south wall faces onto the western portico of peristyle.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: West of room 15, looking north toward the peristyle garden.
column15: West of room 15, looking north toward the peristyle garden.
column21: A large square dining room with large north facing door. Fourth style wall painting. Evidence of a wall painting on the west wall that has been cut out (Check Naples museum). Marble threshold with a tiled floor remains. Marble threshold survives in the northeast corner, leading to an overflow dining room (room 15) to the east. Red, white and green paint survives. Floor survives in the southeast corner containing octagonal tile.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Room 6 to west. Peristyle to northwest.
column15: Room 6 to west. Peristyle to northwest.
column21: Rectangular dining room with wide north facing door towards peristyle at northwest. Overflow door at northwest towards dining room (room 16). Fourth style painting on northwest and southwest walls. Couch niche in southeast corner. Red and yellow paint survive. Check Naples Museum for information on possible cutout on south wall.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 451-453
column14: Peristyle portico to the west.  Kitchen to the east and northeast.
column15: Peristyle portico to the west.  Kitchen to the east and northeast.
column21: Door in the southwest corner opens onto the western portico of the peristyle.  The window faces south.  The room was redecorated after 62 A.D. in Fourth style paintings.  However, little remains.

column14: Garden to west (room 11).  Room 10 to the south.
column15: Garden to west (room 11).  Room 10 to the south.
column21: Rectangular room to east of garden area.  No decoration.  No features.  Much of room is obscured by vegetation making it impossible to see if there is a cooking platform.  Identified by Eschebach as a kitchen. Garden area in process of being rebuilt at time of eruption.

column14: Garden (room 11) to west.  Kitchen (room 9) to north.
column15: Garden (room 11) to west.  Kitchen (room 9) to north.
column21: Small rectangular room adjoining kitchen off of garden to the east.  Small area of white plaster decoration survives in northeast and southwest corners.  No other features.  Identified by Eschebach as a storeroom.

column14: Room 7 to the west.  Room 8 to the southwest.
column15: Room 7 to the west.  Room 8 to the southwest.
column21: Large dining room located at southeast corner of atrium.  Full width opening onto atrium in the northwest corner of the room.  Rectangular room.  Has no evidence of original decoration remaining.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Peristyle portico (room 7) to the south.  Room 5 to the north.  Room 21 to the east.
column15: Peristyle portico (room 7) to the south.  Room 5 to the north.  Room 21 to the east.
column21: Large rectangular dining room with small door in northwest corner facing north to room 5, atrium (room 2), and tablinum (room 21).  Large doorway opening to peristyle (room 19) and portico (room 7).  Marble thresholds remain in both doors.  Plaster with red and yellow paint survives on north, east, west and south walls.  Evidence of floor remains in four corners of the room.

column14: Sales room (room 21) to north. Room 17 to south.
column15: Sales room (room 21) to north. Room 17 to south.
column21: Rectangular room at the rear of the structure.  South of sales room 21.  Traces of red and yellow wall painting survive in east wall and northwest corner.  Doorway opens to room 21 in northwest.  Second blocked doorway to room 21 in northeast.  Doorway in southwest to room 17 and then to room 2 in adjacent house (VIII.4.9).  Eleven amphorae and two dolia were reported by Eschebach somewhere in shop.

column14: Room 20 is to the south.
column21: Sales room opening north threshold preserves traces of doorway.  No counter.  Eschebach refers to discovery of eleven amphorae and two dolia in the shop, but does not specify where.  This shop links to house  (VIII.4.9) to the rear.  Possible wooden stairs on west wall to second story.  Eschebach calls this a wine or oil shop.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Peristyle (room 19) to the west, overlooking water fountain.
column15: Peristyle (room 19) to the west, overlooking water fountain.
column21: Marble threshold remains in large east facing door.  Fourth style painting evident.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: None
column21: Large rectangular room in southeast corner of peristyle.  Large doorway facing west onto peristyle.  Small doorway in north corner leading into kitchen (room 10).  No decoration extant.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: None
column21: Rectangular room with doorway to peristyle (room 7) to southwest.  Threshold remains.  Paint traces in north, south, east and west walls.  Niche on northeast and northwest corners.  Blocked doorway or recess in southeast corner.  Green painted plaster survives at the edge of the recess.  East wall remodeled on new alignment.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Room 11 to the south.  Room 7 to the west.
column15: Room 11 to the south.  Room 7 to the west.
column21: Kitchen located on eastern side of peristyle just north of dining room (room 11).  Small doorway on southeast wall opens into dining room 11. Small doorway on southwest wall opening onto peristyle.  No evidence extant for cooking platform or other kitchen related structures.  On the northeastern side of kitchen was probably a latrine.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Room 15 to the east.
column21: Room faces north.  Small dining room on lower level atrium house in the southwest corner.  Doorway in northwest corner of room opens on to what was a peristyle before being converted to the house.  No decoration extant.  Eschebach designates this room (room 16) as a dining room and room 14 to the east as the kitchen (with the fauces (room 15) in between the two rooms).  There is no evidence to call either one of the other.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: None
column21: Room faces north.  Kitchen on lower level of atrium house in southeast corner.  Doorway in northwest corner of room open on to what was a peristyle before being converted to the house.  No decoration extant.  Eschebach designates this room as a kitchen with room 16 to the west as a dining room though no evidence remains to call either one or the other.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: None
column21: Small round pastry meta.  Location is in west side of peristyle portico in colonnade.  In situ.  Slave mill.  No drawing required.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Couch niche (feature 1577) to east.
column21: Rectangular couch niche.  Plaster with black painting.  Green plant decoration on black background with white trim in north end.  No floor survives.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 518-519
column14: Couch niche (feature 1576) to west.
column21: Rectangular couch niche in northeast corner.  Plaster with black painting.  Green plant painting survives on black painting.  No floor survives.

column14: Two to the west.
column21: It is a food shop with entrance 17 looking north on to Via della Abbondanza while opening 17A looks east onto Via Stabiana. Eschebach notes that there is and L-shaped podium in the north east corner of the shop with one bench opening toward a Via della Abbondanza and the other to Via Stabiana. In the south east corner is a platform with a dolium imbedded. In the south west corner is a passage way leading to room in rear and no decoration extant.

column14: None
column21: Rectangular platform with dolium inserted in the southeast corner or sales room (1). Beside door to the street half lip of dolium survives filled with lapilli.

column14: Room 1 to east.
column21: Rectangular room with a door in the north east corner of sales room (1). Blocked plaster lines decorated recess (possible window or door) in west wall. Eschebach records the discovery of seven amphora in this room.

column14: Preparation room (feature 1583) to the northeast. Room 3 southeast.
column15: Preparation room (feature 1583) to the northeast. Room 3 southeast.
column21: A small rectangular room at the west end of the shop. A doorway faces east in the southeast corner. No decoration exists. Eschebach refers to the existence of an oven of which no trace is surviving. A pipe is running from the floor above in the southeast corner. Evidence of roof beams for a floor seen above on the west wall.

column14: Rooms 2 & 3 to the west.
column21: Room is a small sales room for the food & drink shop. On the east wall is a large doorway opening onto Via Stabiana. No decoration exists.

column14: Salesroom (feature 1582) located to the east.
column21: Preparation room at the rear of sales room (feature 1582). No decoration or flooring remains. Eschebach refers to a large kettle in this room, no trace of which survives. Large square shallow recess in the center of the west wall. Small hole through the wall. Southwest corner to the kitchen (feature 1581) to the west. Traces of lining survives to the rear.

column14: Room 2 to the east.
column21: Small rectangular room with doorway in the southeast corner to bedroom (room 2).  Floor is higher than in room 2.  There is a small niche high in the west wall.  Identification as a kitchen is based on a platform in the corner of the south wall.  There is no decoration.

column14: None
column21: Small square platform showing no recessed storage with a stone surface. Located in the northeast corner, east side of the platform eroded away. No lip.

column14: None
column21: Located in the southeast wall of the oven room are two masonry and rubble supports for a preparation platform.
column25: Sketch1733, Sketch1734, Sketch1735, Sketch1732, Sketch1731, Sketch1586

column14: None
column21: Shrine has a small square altar, with white plaster facing on north, east, and south sides. Unplastered near to the west lip on three sides: north, west and south. No lip on east side.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 526
column14: Room 2 is to northwest.
column21: Large rectangular room. Wide door on east side opening on Via Stabiana. In south east corner is a short counter. On left hand of counter is a 3- step platform for wares. Room was painted, with fragments remaining. In north west corner is door way to room 2.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 526
column14: None
column21: Stepped shelf counter. Three-stepped counter located in the southeast corner of room 1.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column21: Three rubble basins, surrounded by lava paving stones.  Four broken catilli, one in room 5. One and 1/4 meta displaced. One meta in room 5. One beautiful oven with phallic niche over oven. Passthrough to the preparation room (room 5). 1 1/2-1 3/4 inch partially intact oven floor with curved front. Water basin in southwest corner. Preparation platform in corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill (feature 1592). Mill (feature 1593).
column21: Low rubble base is all that remains.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill (feature 1591). Mill (feature 1593).
column21: Low rubble of mill, catillus placed in base.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill (feature 1591), mill (feature 1592), and preparation platform (feature 1604).
column21: Foundation is now rubble, with a vacant place for mill.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Preparation platform to west (feature 1604). Mill to southeast (feature 1593). Mill to east (feature 1591). Mill to southeast (feature 1592).
column16: Preparation platform to west (feature 1604). Mill to southeast (feature 1593). Mill to east (feature 1591). Mill to southeast (feature 1592).
column21: Brick beehive oven with tile base, with two passthroughs to the south and the northeast. There is a vent above the oven. Niche for phallic symbol. Three niches for shelf supports along front of the oven.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill Room to west (room 4). Room 2 to south.
column15: Mill Room to west (room 4). Room 2 to south.
column21: Large doorway onto street on the east. Doorway into mill (room 4) on the west and entrance (room 2) to the south. Big window in upper east wall over door/entrance.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Room 2 to north.
column21: Niche/shelf on west wall.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Room 14 to east. Garden to north (room 10). Room 12 to west.
column15: Room 14 to east. Garden to north (room 10). Room 12 to west.
column21: Rectangular dining room with a wide doorway to the garden (room 10) to the north. No decoration. Walls  collapsed in places and rubble. Described as a dining room by Eschebach.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: None
column21: Covered well in northeast corner of garden extending below the peristyle of house (VIII.4.15). Puteal above enables the occupants of house (VIII.4.15) to access the well. The lip of the well shows considerable wearing. Filled with rubble.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill-oven room to east (room 4).
column21: Room contains one meta and one partial catillus. Passthrough to oven in room 4. Water spout in northwest corner which Eschebach says drained to a lead basin; no longer extant.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill/Oven Room to north (room 4). Storage room to east (room 17).
column15: Mill/Oven Room to north (room 4). Storage room to east (room 17).
column21: Room for preparation and storage of bread and/or flour.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Preparation room to west (room 16).
column21: Long, rectangular room, with an open door on northwest corner. Two south opening, possible drains, at floor level.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Garden to north (room 10). Triclinium to east (room 13). Entrance 20 to west (room 11).
column15: Garden to north (room 10). Triclinium to east (room 13). Entrance 20 to west (room 11).
column21: Small, square room with doorway to north to garden (room 10). No features. Eschebach identifies this as a kitchen. Next to room 11, which is to the west and has an exterior door to the street.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Mill to northeast (feature 1591). Mill to northeast (feature 1592). Mill to northeast (feature 1593).
column16: Mill to northeast (feature 1591). Mill to northeast (feature 1592). Mill to northeast (feature 1593).
column21: Partial water basin in southwest corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Oven to west (feature 1594). Mill to southeast (feature 1593). Mill to south (feature 1591).
column16: Oven to west (feature 1594). Mill to southeast (feature 1593). Mill to south (feature 1591).
column21: Masonry preparation platform on northwest corner has partial tiled surface.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 528
column14: Room 9 to west. Room 7 to south. Room 6 to east.
column15: Room 9 to west. Room 7 to south. Room 6 to east.
column21: Small rectangular dining room with door in southwest corner. Window in west wall overlooking portico (room 9) in garden (room 10). Plaster remains in the northeast and west walls. Red paint remains in northeast and northwest corners with traces on the north wall. Circular designs remain on the north wall. Evidence on north wall may show second story. Large pile of rubble in the southeast corner.

column14: Room 5 is to the south.
column21: Rectangular room with door in northeast corner.  Portions of threshold remain.  Plaster remains seen on west, north and lower northeast corner.  Red paint evident.  Lararium on northwest wall with back altar.  Latrine in northeast corner with possible support niches for wooden seat.  Cooking platform supports along south wall.  Possible window in south wall above cooking platform.

column14: Masonry supports (feature 1608) to south. Latrine (feature 1609) to northeast.
column16: Masonry supports (feature 1608) to south. Latrine (feature 1609) to northeast.
column21: Lararium niche is located in the west wall. There is a brick altar below lararium. No traces of decoration remain, although some plaster remains.  See description in Fiorelli, Boyce and Orr.

column14: Lararium to northwest (feature 1607). Latrine to northeast (feature 1609).
column16: Lararium to northwest (feature 1607). Latrine to northeast (feature 1609).
column21: There are three masonry supports for cooking platform located along the south wall. Supports for wooden platform would allow for fuel niche below.

column14: Lararium to west (feature 1607). Masonry supports for cooking platform to south (feature 1608).
column16: Lararium to west (feature 1607). Masonry supports for cooking platform to south (feature 1608).
column21: Latrine located in northeast corner of kitchen (room 16). Plaster remains in lower northeast corner of latrine. Possible seat groove along east wall.

column14: Room 7 to the north.  Room 13 to the south.
column15: Room 7 to the north.  Room 13 to the south.
column21: Peristyle garden located south of tablinum.  In southeast corner are located two dolia from the original seven.  Of the two extant dolia, the west one is significantly larger than the east one.  The dolia on the west is heavily damaged.  On west side of garden along inside wall is a large lead pipe leading from the atrium areas.  At the center of the west wall of the garden, under a built in relieving arch, are three water valves.

column14: West dolia (feature 1612) is to the west.
column16: West dolia (feature 1612) is to the west.
column21: The east dolia is smaller than the west dolia.  Complete but damaged.

column14: East dolium (feature 1611) to the east.
column21: The west dolium is larger than the east dolium. Heavily damaged.  Missing top half.

column14: Room 15 to the north.  Room 11 to the north.
column15: Room 15 to the north.  Room 11 to the north.
column21: Large rectangular dining hall.  Support for beams for floor above high in east and northwest wall.  Plaster in south wall.  Southwest corner races of red low register and white upper register.  Poorly preserved.

column14: Room 15 to the north.
column21: Very large dining room.  Rectangular opening to the north to garden (room 15).  No decoration remains.

column14: Garden (room 15) to the west.  Dining room (room 9) to the south.
column15: Garden (room 15) to the west.  Dining room (room 9) to the south.
column21: Small square dining room located on northeast side of garden.  On west wall is a doorway and there is a small window south of the door looking out onto garden.  Room was decorated in stucco and paint.  The ceiling seems to be vaulted.  Original decoration seriously damaged but traces remain.

column14: None
column21: Small square dining room.  Located on east side of garden.  Door to the west in center of the wall.  Extant painting on four walls.  Fourth style painting in room.  White upper register.  With red trim, above red and yellow lower panels with traces of green, white and red trim on lower panels.  Identification as a dining room based on decoration and position to garden and function of property as a whole as a restaurant.  Blocked doorway in northwest corner from an earlier phase.

column14: Garden (room 5) to south
column21: Large rectangular dining room.    Doorway in southwest corner.  Marble threshold remains in portions.  Window along south wall with marble lintel overlooking garden (room 5).  Evidence of second floor survives along north wall.  Wall painting survives along north, south, east and west walls.  White background with yellow and red trim.

column14: None
column21: Eschebach locates a kitchen to the west of dining room and bedroom.  No trace remains; probably located under stairs in northwest corner to peristyle (room 5).

column14: None
column21: Rectangular room with stairs in southwest corner to floor above. Doorway in southeast corner with grooves to sliding door. Square pillar in center of room. No traces of counter. Doorway to house 33. No other features.

column14: None
column21: Rectangular room with northwest facing door to portico.  Threshold remains in doorway.  Door along south wall with remains of threshold, partially blocked by stairs to back of building.  Cooking platform along west wall.  Doorway facing in east corner leads to the small street or alley on east side of temple complex.  In northeast door leading to the temple, that door is arched.  On eastern wall to right of cooking platform is a door leading to the small triclinium probably used by priests.

column14: Peristyle portico (room 1) to the east.
column21: North room behind the temple peristyle.  Take over from Samnite palestra.  Place where you could have a ritual initiation dining.  Fronted by arches.  Was added after 62 A.D.  Remnants of plaster in southwest corner.

column14: Masonry supports for preparation platform to the south.
column16: Masonry supports for preparation platform to the south.
column21: Located in kitchen on west side of room.  Large, made of two parts.  Upper part is a cooking platform covered with an arch.  The lower part has an arched recess for the storage of fuel or ash.  The platform and arch make up approximately 60% of the height of the cooking structure.  The cooking arch (sides) are brick covered.  The arch itself is limestone blocks.

column14: Cooking platform (feature 1624) to the north.
column21: Located against the southwest wall are two masonry supports for a preparation platform.  It is poorly preserved and no traces remain.

column14: Peristyle portico (room 1) to north.  Kitchen (room 9) to east.
column15: Peristyle portico (room 1) to north.  Kitchen (room 9) to east.
column21: Some red plaster remains in the southeast and southwest walls.  Small doorway in northeast corner to kitchen.  Centered wide arched door in north wall.  Raised step doorway.  Rectangular in shape.

column14: Kitchen (room 9) to the northeast.
column21: This is a small room on the southeast corner of the temple complex.  It is entered from the kitchen area understairs.  In the southwest corner of the room is a structure made of three parts.  On the right is what appears to be steps leading to a platform, most of which is taken up by a vat-like construction which has been plastered by white plaster.  The vat-like structure is rectangular in shape.  As extant, the vat is about 2.5 inches deep.  In the south of the structure below the vat is a recess that goes back under the vat and seems to end at the wall at the northeast.

column14: None
column21: In the southwest/west corner of the room is a vat-like structure made up of three parts.  On the north part of the structure appears to be steps leading to a platform.  Most of the platform appears to be taken up by a vat-like structure which is plaster with white plaster.  The vat-like structure is rectangular shaped.  As extant, the vat is about 2.5 inches deep.  In the south of the structure below the vat is a recess that goes back under the vat and seems to end at the wall at the northeast.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 531-532
column14: Peristyle (room 1) to east. To north is room 4.
column15: Peristyle (room 1) to east. To north is room 4.
column21: T-shaped room with broader end to south. Stairs to floor above in northwest end and door to peristyle (room 1) to southeast. Threshold remains. Latrine in southwest corner with cooking platform adjoining latrine against west wall. Vent window high above cooking platform. Embedded in west wall is pipe not necessarily associated with this room. Floor level is above that of peristyle.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 531-532
column14: Latrine to south (feature 1631).
column21: Rectangular platform with storage below, tiled surface, front does not survive. Separated from latrine to south by low partition wall. Window or vent high above in west wall.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 531-532
column14: Cooking platform to the north.
column21: Located in alcove between cooking platform and south wall in southwest corner.  A hole in the southwest corner drains through the wall.  A pipe is inserted in the west wall above the latrine.  It is not certain if it is associated with the room.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 531-532
column14: Room 1 to the south, 6 to the west.
column15: Room 1 to the south, 6 to the west.
column21: Located on the north side of the house.  Enter from tetrastyle atrium.  This is a large square room, originally well decorated.  Not much extant.  On the east wall, just inside are three steps leading to a room at a higher level which is probably a bedroom.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 8, 531-532
column14: Kitchen (room 3) to the south.
column21: This is a rectangular room with a door to a kitchen in the south wall.  The western end is arched below stairs that run from kitchen (room 3) to floor above.  Two holes in the east wall were perhaps used to support shelves.

column14: To north (room 2).
column21: Square room with large opening onto street to south. In northwest corner is doorway to room 2. North and east walls have an abutting cooking platform. At south end of platform, on east wall is a hearth, circular in shape. Cooking platform is made of rubble. Hearth is constructed of broken tiles covered in rubble.

column14: None
column21: Cooking platform on north and east wall. At south end of platform, on east wall is a hearth, circular in shape. Cooking platform is made of rubble. Hearth is constructed of broken tiles covered in rubble.

column14: To west (room 4). To east (room 6) Window.
column21: Triclinium located on north side of house in middle. Opening to west, room 4. On east wall was a window, according to Eschebach, looking into kitchen. In northeast corner, the wall projects into the room creating a smaller dining area. Walls were once decorated but decoration is no longer extant.

column14: To west (room 2). To west (room 5) window.
column21: Located in the northeast side on house. Approached through hallway from room 2 to west. In southeast corner in kitchen is the latrine. In northeast corner, a dolium is embedded a stone circular platform. Between latrine and dolium installation along east wall was a possible cooking platform.

column14: Latrine to south (feature 1639). Dolium to north (feature 1640).
column16: Latrine to south (feature 1639). Dolium to north (feature 1640).
column21: Possible cooking platform.  Low, originally rectangular platform against east wall between dolium and latrine. Only small portion remains.

column14: Possible cooking platform to north (feature 1638). Dolium to north (feature 1640).
column16: Possible cooking platform to north (feature 1638). Dolium to north (feature 1640).
column21: Located in the southeast corner of room. Wall on the west and north side with entrance at the northwest corner. Latrine on east wall has two terra cotta pipes from upper floor. In southern part is the pit. Seating is missing but a floor tile constructed at an angle would direct the waste material into the pit.

column14: Latrine to south (feature 1639). Possible cooking platform to south (feature 1638).
column16: Latrine to south (feature 1639). Possible cooking platform to south (feature 1638).
column21: Located in the northeast corner of the room. Semicircular rubble platform where a dolium was once embedded.

column14: Room 1 to the south, rooms 3 and 4 to the east.
column15: Room 1 to the south, rooms 3 and 4 to the east.
column21: Sales room opening west to the street.  No counter.  Traces of red plaster survive on the northwest corner.  The threshold contains grooves for a door.  Eschebach records stairs to the left (south) of the shop, however, there is no trace of stairs or any other features still extant.
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Salesroom (room 2) to west.
column21: A small square room with convex east wall.  East wall appears to be remodeled in several phases blocking earlier doorway.  Plaster survives in the northeast corner with a white background and red border.  A wide doorway opens west to a salesroom.  Eschebach calls this a dining room.
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Room 5 to the east, room 2 to the west.
column15: Room 5 to the east, room 2 to the west.
column21: The room is located on the eastern side of the house between the salesroom and storage room.  One enters the preparation room from an andron to the south of salesroom (room 3).  The south corner of the western wall has been cut to create a wider entrance into the room.  Along the western wall appear to be two installations.  The one on the north was perhaps a preparation platform.  The one on the south seems to have been built up at the bottom.  Though clear evidence is lacking, it may have held water.  The vat and the platform share one wall which brings up the possibility that the shared wall was actually a central pillar for a long preparation platform.  Plaster remains high on the east wall but no paint remains.  The western wall upon which the vat lies may have had an opening into salesroom (room 3) but there is no clear evidence of it.
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Room 4 to the west.  Window in the south wall opens to room 3 of house VIII.4.37.  Window in the north wall opens to room 17 of house VIII.4.4.
column15: Room 4 to the west.  Window in the south wall opens to room 3 of house VIII.4.37.  Window in the north wall opens to room 17 of house VIII.4.4.
column21: Rectangular room with windows in the north and south walls.  There is also a blocked window high in the northwest wall.  Open windows provide access to adjoining properties.  Plaster survives on the east wall.  Holes on the north and west walls were possibly used for shelving.  Eschebach calls it a light well, however, Fiorelli calls it cold storage for meat.  Accessed through the doorway in the west wall to room 4.
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Vat (feature 1646) to the south.
column21: Located in the northwest corner.  All that remains are the north and south pillars.
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Preparation platform (feature 1645) to the north.
column21: A vat, possibly for water, is located on the western wall of the room just south of preparation platform (feature 1645).  The vat and platform share a wall.  The bottom of the vat seems to have been built up to a level higher than the preparation platform, although the assumption is that the vat contained water.  There is no evidence of opus signinum.  Though no evidence remains, there may have been a window opening above the vat to salesroom (room 3).
column70: Shop for Dairy and Meat Products

column14: Storage room to east (room 2). Corridor to east (room 4).
column15: Storage room to east (room 2). Corridor to east (room 4).
column21: Sales Room. Large doorway to east with opening to west to street. Threshold contains grooves for door. No counter. A few traces of painting survive on the south wall, white with red trim. Fiorelli identifies this as a wine shop because of a painting no longer in situ showing grapes, wine, and wine vessels.

column14: Room 4 to west.
column21: Small rectangular room under stairs along southern wall to floor above. Stairs are accessed from room 4. Latrine in northeast corner. Cooking platform in southeast corner.

column14: Latrine to north (feature 1650).
column21: Rectangular masonry with no storage. Surface does not survive. Not clear if tiled or lipped.

column14: Cooking platform to south (feature 1649).
column21: Tile built support survives in northeast corner. This is all that remains. No drain or other feature survive.

column14: Store room to east (room 3). Sales room to west (room 1).
column15: Store room to east (room 3). Sales room to west (room 1).
column21: Square room with plaster preserved along north wall, white with yellow border. No other features. Wide doorway west to shop (room 1). Wide doorway to storage (room 3). Position in rear of sales room suggests use as a storage room.

column14: Storage room to west (room 2).
column21: Square room at rear of shop.  Plaster survives on north wall with red border on white background. Simplistic red decorated trim (poorly executed).  Wide doorway west to room 2.  Position in rear suggests use as store room.

column14: Room 2 to the west.
column21: Room is entered by a doorway on the south and can be shut with sliding panels the rest of the way.  On the north side, steps with possible latrine underneath.  On the south side, just as you enter is a masonry cooking platform.  The room itself is rather large and rectangular in shape.  The walls were plastered and decorated but painting is not extant.

column14: None
column21: Located in sales room in the southwest corner.  Platform is rectangular in shape.  There is broken tile (assumed to be original) on the surface and in an arched opening for fuel storage.

column14: Room 1 to the west.
column21: Located to the east of the sales room (room 1).  It's width is approximately 60% of the sales room.  Probably used as a storeroom, though it was decorated, some of which still remains.  One enters the room through a small door in the southeast corner.

column14: Room 2 to west.
column21: Rectangular room at rear southeast of sales room (room 2). Plan shows wide doorway and wall separating rooms 1 and 2, but no longer extant. A little bit of plaster remains in the southeast corner. Position at rear of sales room suggests use for storage.

column14: Room 1 to east.
column21: One enters the sales room from the west through entrance 51. The room extends the entire length from the north to the south walls. In the north part of the room, under stairs entered through entrance 52, were found four dolia for oil. In the south wall, just after entering, was a niche lararium. No decoration remains. To the east of the room are two other rooms to the north and south.

column14: None
column21: Altar is identified by placement, with statue pedestal and stairs behind pedestal.

column14: Feature 1660 to the east.
column21: Poorly preserved rectangular altar.  Possible top part partly preserved with traces of lip on three sides.  No inscription.  No decoration.  Possible marble facing on north side of base.  ( (Looking from the Doric Temple, this is the right altar.)

column14: Feature 1661 to the west; feature 1659 to the east.
column16: Feature 1661 to the west; feature 1659 to the east.
column21: Small square altar, no inscription.  Molded lip on two sides.  (Looking from the Doric Temple, this is the middle altar.)

column14: Feature 1660 to the west.
column21: Tripartite, rectangular tufa altar.  No inscription.  Preserved molding and lip.  (Looking from the Doric Temple, this is the altar on the left.)

column14: None
column21: Located in the forecourt directly in front of the steps leading up to the cella.  The altar is situated perpendicular to the steps, and made of limestone and tufa.  It is sculpted in the Doric Order.  At the top on each end parallel to the steps is a sculpted roll.  The altar sits on a wider foundation.

column14: Garden (room 11) to the east.
column21: Located in southwest corner of garden is a kitchen described by Eschebach as a bake oven.  Today it is completely rubble with no discernible features.  The kitchen is divided on the east from the garden by a wall.  No drawing needed.

column14: Atrium (room 8) to west, peristyle (room 10) to south, room 14 to east.
column15: Atrium (room 8) to west, peristyle (room 10) to south, room 14 to east.
column21: Rectangular dining room facing south over garden.  The south end of the portico has collapsed.  Doorway in the southwest corner opens to the atrium (room 8). A window is high in the northwest corner; a large gap  below is a possible second window.  Another gap in north wall is another possible window.  There is a window in the northeast corner, and a doorway in the southeast corner.  Flooring not preserved but there is plaster with red paint in the northwest corner.

column14: Room 7 to west; 18 to south; 2 to north.
column15: Room 7 to west; 18 to south; 2 to north.
column21: Window over platform in west wall.  Cooking platform in northwest corner.  Unusual entrance from street and other front rooms.  Possible front doorway from earlier maps.

column14: None
column21: Cooking platform in northwest corner of room.  Window above in west wall, above cooking platform for venting.

column14: Dining room (room 9) to west.
column21: Small rectangular room accessed from dining room (room 9) to west.  There is plaster on the walls, but no evidence of paint.  Proximity to dining room and small size suggest it was used for food serving.  Allison places brazier for reheating food in the proximity of the dining room.

column14: Room 8 to east, room 10 to south.
column15: Room 8 to east, room 10 to south.
column21: Small dining room located in southwest portion of atrium.  The doorway leading into atrium on the east wall has a light well over it. The doorway on the south wall opens onto the garden leading to the south.  The room is rectangular in shape and was decorated, with only a small portion extant.

column14: Room 6 to east.
column21: Rectangular room with door in southeast corner. Plaster with no paint remains in room. Niche on north wall. Possible traces of partition wall in southwest corner, perhaps dividing the western end of wall.

column14: Room 10 to north.
column21: Rectangular room accessed from room 10 in the north wall, filled with rubble and debris.  No features remain.  Identified as a kitchen by Eschebach.

column14: Corridor (room 12) to west.
column21: Rectangular vaulted room. Plaster-lined walls and ceiling. Filled with debris. Not able to enter or identify doorway visible from corridor (room 12).

column14: Corridor (room 12) to northwest.
column21: Rectangular room with vaulted ceiling; plaster-lined walls and ceiling. Plaster floor. Recess in northeast corner, possibly collapsed. Drain in center of ceiling. Stairs down from corridor (room 12) in the northwest corner.

column14: Room 12 to the east. Room 13 to the south.
column15: Room 12 to the east. Room 13 to the south.
column21: Long rectangular room, vaulted, with plaster-lined ceiling and walls. Plaster has been deliberately removed from walls. Terra cotta pipe in ceiling draining from above. Blocked vent in ceiling at southwest corner. Plaster floor. Access from corridor (room 12) to northeast. Low door in south wall leads into room 13.

column14: Room 13 to north.
column21: Rectangular vaulted room. Plaster survives only at the base. The room is obscured by debris. Plastered cistern opens against the center of the south wall. Same size and length as room 14 to the north. Access through a low doorway in the  north wall. Cistern opens to the peristyle in the House of M. Popidius Natalis (VIII.7.27).

column14: Atrium to north.
column21: Kitchen is located on the south side of the atrium, entered from the north by several steps (number unknown) to the lower level. Vaulted roof. No clear evidence of venting for smoke. In southwest corner is a deep vaulted storage area running to the west. Access to the storage area is high on the wall. On the northeast corner of the room is a possible window to a small room to the east. There may have been a cooking platform in the northeast corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 1
column14: Room 3 to south, room 4 to southeast, Via Stabiana to the west.
column15: Room 3 to south, room 4 to southeast, Via Stabiana to the west.
column21: Rectangular room with two wide doorways to street at west.  Threshold is obscured.  Small square room to south with doorway to rear in southeast corner.  Blocked, plaster-lined, narrow recess or door in east behind counter.  L-shaped counter in northwest corner with hearth.  The counter is placed back from street by half meter to allow people to come into shop to purchase food.  Blocked doorway in northeast corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 1
column14: None
column21: Counter with three right angle turns.  Recessed from street by half meter.   Hearth at east end; restored countertop in cement.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 1
column14: Sales room (room 1) to north.
column21: Small, square room to south of sales room with wide doorway to north.  Blocked narrow doorway to west.

column14: Kitchen to the east (room 2), dining room to the northeast (room 3).
column15: Kitchen to the east (room 2), dining room to the northeast (room 3).
column21: One enters from southwest through entrance 2.  The room has on the western wall a platform with three dolia embedded.  To the east of platform with dolia is a second platform without dolia.  Room opens to north into a triclinium and to east into kitchen.  The room was at one time plastered but not much extant.  On the northeast wall, located between the entrances to the kitchen and dining room, is what appears to be a lararium.  The lararium is open through to the dining room.

column14: Counter with dolia (feature 1681) is northwest.
column21: Counter without dolia is located to the southeast of a counter with dolia.  The counter is same length as other counter and effectively divides selling space in half.

column14: Counter without dolia (feature 1680) to the southeast.
column16: Counter without dolia (feature 1680) to the southeast.
column21: Counter with dolia located on northwest wall just inside entrance.  The top has been reconstructed and counter contains three dolia. The dolia are placed to provide a wider surface near door.

column14: Salesroom to southwest (room 1).
column21: Room on east side of house, identified as kitchen.   Identified by cooking platform as one enters room on right.  Irregular shaped rectangular room. Locked doorway on the west wall to the south of the platform. Small fragments of plaster are found on the south side of the doorway. No other decoration remains. The room is on a NE/SW axis.

column14: None
column21: Located in the southwest corner of room to right of door as you enter.  Platform is rather low.  The ends on both sides rise up to form arms.

column14: Salesroom to southwest (room 1).
column21: Located on northeast part of house and entered from salesroom from southwest.  Rectangular in shape.  At  one time decorated, but only small fragments of red, green and yellow plaster remain. Room is on a NE/SW axis. Inserted into the pillar to the east of the entrance is a open niche that extends completely through the pillar. Eschebach refers to it as a lararium, but it may be a pass through to the dining area.

column14: Counter with dolia (feature 1681), counter without dolia (feature 1680).
column16: Counter with dolia (feature 1681), counter without dolia (feature 1680).
column21: Lararium is located on northeast wall, between the kitchen and dining room entrances.  Shape is arched at top and is open through wall to dining room.  No evidence of painting remains.

column14: Back room to south (room 3), sales room to west (room 1).
column15: Backroom to south (room 3), sales room to west (room 1).
column21: One enters shop through entrance 4, to southwest. In the center of the room are the remains of a possible counter. The room is roughly square and opens directly in back to room 3. On the western wall, there is access to room 1.

column14: Sales room to southeast (room 4). Store room (room 2) to northeast.
column15: Sales room to southeast (room 4). Store room (room 2) to northeast.
column21: Room is roughly square in shape with access to room 2 in the northeast. Excavator found remains of bread in one of the rooms.

column14: None
column21: The counter is in the center of the room, rectangular in shape with a northeast axis. As extent, facing is unknown.

column14: Sales room to west (room 1).
column21: Square room with wide doorway west to room 1. Traces of undecorated plaster remain in southeast and northwest corners.

column14: Rooms 7,8, and 9 to south.
column21: Eschebach identifies a kitchen; however we were not able to confirm this as room 7,8,9 were inaccessible due to heavy vegetation. No drawing required.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 4
column14: Storeroom (room 4) to northeast.  Hallway (room 2) to southeast.
column15: Storeroom (room 4) to northeast.  Hallway (room 2) to southeast.
column21: Entrance 9 to the southwest street.  Roughly rectangular in shape.  On the southeast wall is entrance in large hallway, Entrance 8.  On the northeast wall is a doorway leading to storeroom in back. Set slightly back from Entrance 6 is an L-shaped counter with a dolium in the portion of the counter parallel to the street.  The room was decorated but only a small portion with red paint remains in the northwest corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 4
column14: None
column21: L-shaped counter with shortest side parallel to the street.  Embedded with a single dolium.  The long portion of the counter extends back halfway into the opening to the hallway entrance.  As extant, it is difficult to determine facing.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 4
column14: Salesroom (room 3) to the southwest.
column21: Storeroom is located to the northeast of the salesroom.  The room is roughly square and appears to have had a doorway in the northeast.  The counter is not blocked up with tile.  It was originally decorated but little plaster remains.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 4
column14: None
column21: On the south side of the entrance is a cooking platform of rubble and brick.  Just after the doorway is the entrance to room 1.  As extant, it is difficult to determine the original form.  Eschebach indicates that excavators found lead and bronze vessels.

column14: Room 1 contiguous with rooms 2 and 6, both cubicula.
column15: Room 1 contiguous with rooms 2 and 6, both cubicula.
column21: One enters the salesroom through the entrance from the south.  There is an L-shaped counter, the longest branch parallel to the street.  On the branch perpendicular to the street there were two embedded dolia, incorrectly restored with one dolium today.  On the northwest wall there was a platform no longer extant.  On the southwest wall there was a place for a brazier no longer extant.  Partial plaster remains in corner to right of Entrance 1.  Very small amounts of reddish paint remain extant.

column14: Platform on the north wall no longer extant.  Place for brazier on the southeast corner, no longer extant.
column16: Platform on the north wall no longer extant.  Place for brazier on the southeast corner, no longer extant.
column21: The L-shaped counter is located in the sales room to the left of Entrance 1.  The long arm is parallel to the street.  The arm perpendicular to the street originally had 2 dolia embedded.  It was incorrectly restored today with only one dolium.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 16
column14: Storeroom (room 2) to the northeast.
column21: One enters room 1 from west Entrance 8.  To the left and set back from the entrance is an L-shaped counter.  On the northwest wall is a second rectangular counter.  The room is roughly square.  To the northwest is the entrance to the storeroom at the rear.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 16
column14: The second counter located to the northwest.
column16: The second counter located to the northwest.
column21: L-shaped counter.  The counter is located at the entrance and set back slightly from the sidewalk.  The long arm of the counter is parallel to the street; the shorter arm is roughly perpendicular.  As reconstructed, there is one embedded dolium located at the eastern end of the short arm of the counter.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 16
column14: Counter (feature 1705) to the south.  Lararium (feature 1707) to the west on wall above.
column16: Counter (feature 1705) to the south.  Lararium (feature 1707) to the west on wall above.
column21: Dolium in counter:  Located on the north wall of the room; contains 3 embedded dolia as reconstructed.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 16
column14: Below the lararium is the western end of counter (feature 1706).
column16: Below the lararium is the western end of counter (feature 1706).
column21: The lararium is located on the northwest wall just above the west end of counter (feature 1706).  The lararium is rectangular in shape as extant.  It is plastered on the interior but nothing else remains.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 16
column14: Counter room to the west.
column21: The storeroom is located in the northeast of the house behind the counter room.  The room is roughly square in shape and at one time had stairs on the north wall, but are no longer extant.  At the back of the room on the west and east walls were niches that may have contained a bed.  Some traces of red paint remained on both niches.

column14: Garden (room 7) to east.  Corridor (room 5) to south.
column15: Garden (room 7) to east.  Corridor (room 5) to south.
column21: Rectangular dining room with doorway in southeast corner and large window east into garden (room 7).  Painting survives on northwest and south walls:  red and yellow panels and white molding above.  Small plastered window high in west wall.  Long plaster red line painted in recess in northwest corner.  Possible blocked recess in southwest corner, its function unknown.  Floor is obscured by vegetation.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 18-19

column14: Tablinum.
column21: Covered niche in atrium.  It is painted elaborately in Fourth style, notched for future painting.  Colors are red, white, beige, and yellow.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 18-19

column14: Corridor to west (room 5).  Dining room to west (room 6).  Kitchen to south (room 8).  Unknown room to south (room 9).
column15: Corridor to west (room 5).  Dining room to west (room 6).  Kitchen to south (room 8).  Unknown room to south (room 9).
column21: Rectangular garden containing an L-shaped masonry dining couch in northwest corner.  According to Eschebach there is a storage niche under the north couch and a drain into a large pool in center of garden.  A masonry table apparently stood next to the north couch; not visible due to cover of vegetation.  A plaster-lined lararium niche is in the northwest corner above couch.  Red background, blue plaster ceiling and traces of plaster molding found on the rear wall. No other decorative elements survive.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 18-19

column14: Storeroom to northeast.
column21: One enters through the southwest.  On left is an L-shaped counter:  the long arm of the counter is parallel to street, and the short arm is perpendicular.  Eschebach indicates there were three embedded dolia, but after reconstruction, there are none.  Walls were once decorated, but nothing extant.  Counter set back from sidewalk slightly.  In the eastern corner of the room there seems to have been stairs that may have led into house I.2.10.  It appears this was blocked in A.D. 79.  In the northeast portion of room is a doorway leading to a storeroom in the rear.

column14: None
column21: L-shaped counter.  Counter is set back slightly from entrance.  Longer side parallels street, the shorter side perpendicular.  Eschebach reported three embedded dolia, which no longer exist after reconstruction.

column14: Counter room to southwest (room 1).
column21: Storeroom located in north part of shop, behind counter room.  Room is small and square and originally decorated, but very little remains.  In northeastern corner of room there was once a doorway opening up to atrium of structure I.2.10.  Doorway had been closed prior to the time of the eruption.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 26
column14: Storeroom (room 2) to northeast.  Room 4 to southeast.
column15: Storeroom (room 2) to northeast.  Room 4 to southeast.
column21: Entered through entrance 13 from the southwest.  Most of entrance is blocked by a counter parallel to the street.  The second and longest arm of the counter is perpendicular to the street.  Eschebach indicates one dolium in the long arm, but it was not included in the reconstruction.  Room is rectangular in shape, once decorated, much of which still remains.  At the back of the room on the northeast wall is the entrance to the storeroom.  Just inside the room on the right to the southeast is a doorway into room 4.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 26
column14: None
column21: The L-shaped counter has its short side to the street.  The long side is perpendicular to the street.  Eschebach indicates that the long side had embedded dolia.  After reconstruction no dolia remain.  The counter was reconstructed of rubble with a top of pieces of broken rubble.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 26
column14: Salesroom (room 1) to west.
column21: Plan shows small square room behind salesroom (room 1) to the southwest.  Only the north and northwest corners survive.  Others walls no longer extant.  Plaster or marble wall undecorated.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 37-38
column14: Room 2 to southeast. Room 5 to southwest.
column15: Room 2 to southeast. Room 5 to southwest.
column21: One enters counter room from north. L-shaped counter has longest arm parallel to street; the shorter side is perpendicular. The shorter arm has at the end facilities for cooking. The arm parallel to street had four dolia, the perpendicular arm has two dolia. The room itself is small, roughly rectangular. On the northeast wall is what appears to be a rectangular lararium. Above this, running the length of the wall are two sets of holes that once supported shelves. On the southwest wall is the opening to small room (room 5). On the southeast wall is a large opening into room 2. On the northeast wall is evidence of a replastering that covered a painted wall, a large part of which is extant.
column70: House of Dometrius and Helpis Afra

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 37-38
column14: None
column21: The L-shaped counter has its long arm parallel to the street; the short arm is perpendicular. In the long arm are embedded four different sized dolia. The short arm perpendicular to the street has two embedded dolia. At the end of this area there was constructed a facility for heating. The counter is rather low, relative to counters in other shops.
column70: House of Dometrius and Helpis Afra

column15: Room 2 to north. Garden to west (room 6).

column14: None
column21: Rectangular tufa fountain drains into street at base of north wall. The fountain above the west wall is decorated with concentric circles.

column14: Room 19 to southeast. Room 21 to northwest.
column15: Room 19 to southeast. Room 21 to northwest.
column21: One approaches the peristyle through entrance 2 and through two intervening rooms. On the southwest wall is a masonry triclinium with three couches and a central table. The triclinium faces northeast onto a colonnade. The colonnade had a gutter around three sides.

column14: None
column21: Triclinium is located in the southeast part of the peristyle. The middle couch abuts against the wall. Between the lower and higher couch is a rectangular couch once covered by a mosaic design. The masonry triclinium faces northeast.

column14: None
column21: Fountain located on west side of Via Stabiana, just inside the Porta Stabiana and diagonally across from I.1.1. Rectangular structure. On west side rising above the height of wall is a decorative sculpture, maybe Medusa. There would have been a pipe connected to water supply that penetrated sculpture which would have entered into structure. Does not seem to be a drain in the interior of the fountain.

column14: Salesroom (room 1) and a preparation room (room 3).
column21: The entrance to a very large beehive oven is in this room.  Two masonry platforms on either side of the oven entrance.  The beehive of the oven encroaches into Room 3 (a preparation room).  In addition, two masonry supports for perhaps a wooden table top are against the south wall of this room.
column25: Sketch1731, Sketch1732, Sketch1733, Sketch1734, Sketch1735, Sketch1586

column14: Room 2 (oven room).
column21: The room has two windows in the south wall and a low cutout in the wall that was probably for a wooden table.  On the east wall is a niche.  On the west wall is a plastered niche.  From the north, the curved wall of the oven encroaches into the room.
column25: Sketch1732, Sketch1731, Sketch1733, Sketch1734, Sketch1735, Sketch1586

column14: None
column15: Connected to the preparation room (room 3) and to the salesroom (room 1).
column21: The entrance to the oven is framed in lava.  The huge beehive is unenclosed.  Two masonry platforms are below the entrance to the oven.  There is no sign of a water basin.  There is no sign of the flue still in existence.

column15: Store room to the east (room 4).  Oven room to the north (room 2).

On the east wall is an opening to the store room.  On the north corner is the entrance to the oven room.  The entrance is across from the Odeon entrance.

column14: None
column21: Altar in vaulted, plastered niche with tufa and dedicated to Lares Compitales. Scroll decoration on top of altar; no inscription or painting survive.

column14: None
column21: Square tufa fountain with fountainhead on southern face. No decoration survives. Drain in northwest corner. Lined with opus signinum.

column14: None
column21: Rectangular tufa fountain with drain in center of the west side. Fountainhead in center of the north side with bearded human face, possibly Pan.

column14: None
column21: Small brick built altar with step in front.  Built into undecorated recess. Plain plaster survives on north side of recess, top surface of altar and side of altar. No other decoration.

column14: None
column21: Square tufa fountain. Drain in the center of the north wall and second drain at the base at center of north wall. Base is lined with course opus signinum. Fountainhead in center of west side with bull's head decoration.

column14: None
column21: One enters the shop through entrance 2 to the southwest. On the right one enters the steps to upper floor. On the left is an L-shaped counter with shelves. The room is rectangular in shape along axis of street. The shop was probably decorated but little of plaster remains.

column14: None
column21: The L-shaped counter has its long arm parallel to the street. Its short arm is perpendicular. At the northwestern end of the long arm are three stepped shelves. This arm has three embedded dolia. The short arm has one. Eschebach and PPM show perpendicular arm as longer and containing three dolia.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Atrium to the west (room 2).
column21: Square room with a marble threshold including reused inscription opening to the west. Extant painting in the northeast and southeast corners; red and green borders with white background, identified as Fourth style by PPM.  Molded plaster on entrance creating a faux column.  Identification as a dining tablinum based on the floor with marble centerpiece around which the couches would have been placed, and visibility from the street.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Atrium to southwest (room 2).
column21: Rectangular dining room with a doorway in the southwest corner on to atrium (room 2). Extensive extant painting; black lower register with white trim with red and yellow panels above.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Room 19 to the west. Room 17 to the south.
column15: Room 19 to the west. Room 17 to the south.
column21: Rectangular room with blocked doorway in the northwest corner to stairway (room 5). Narrow doorway in northwest corner to corridor (room 19) and doorway in center of south wall to room 17. Only decoration that survives is in the north and northeast corner with black plaster.  Identification as a dining room is based on low plaster-lined niche (feature 1746) in northeast corner.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: None
column21: Low, shallow plaster-lined couch niche with dark-black paint in northeast corner of room. No other decoration survives.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Colonnade of Peristyle to southeast (room 8).
column21: On the north side of the peristyle, on the northwest corner is a triclinium which is open the full width of the door. On the western wall, at back is a dining couch niche. Room was decorated in antiquity. A good bit of paint remains.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Colonnade to peristyle (room 8).
column21: In the southwest corner of peristyle is a triclinium facing east/northeast. The room is open almost the full width of the opening. The room is almost square and in the northwest corner appears to be a doorway. No evidence of wall painting remains.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Storage room to east (room 24).
column21: Wide entrance off the street from south with vaulted room. On the right is a larger half-window leading to storage area. On the east wall is a large preparation table between small arched window and arched doorway. Small arched doorway leads to a storage room. On the north wall are two large entrances. On the west wall is a water tank. Also on the west wall is an arched recess over a cooking platform leading to an arched window and leading to two vents. Under platform is an arched fuel holder. South entrance is large enough for carts to pull up to unload so as not to block traffic on main street.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Atrium to the north (room 2).
column21: Small square room with wide doorway north to atrium (room 2). Plaster on east, south and west walls is undecorated and in process of being replastered. Supports for three tiers of shelves on the east, south and west walls. PPM identifies this as an apotheca.

column8: Pugliese, Pompei Pitture e Mosaici, Vol. 1, 64-65
column14: Kitchen to west (room 16).
column21: Low, arched doorway leading to a small room with a vent in the ceiling. On the south and north walls are two niches, each to support poles, possibly for hanging grain sacks or amphorae.

column16: Cooking platform to south (feature 1753). Stone basin to south (feature 1753).

column16: Cooking platform to south (feature 1754). Basin to north (feature 1752).

column16: Stone basin to north (feature 1753). Preparation platform to the east (feature 1755).
column21: Square cooking platform recessed into southwest corner. Tile surface, arched storage below, vaulted ceiling above with two terra cotta vents on southern face.  Large opening to the west above the platform; not clear if this was originally a window.
